values:
I can't see when it hurts.
I can't breathe without hurting.
I can't see while I'm breathing.

You are the air I breathe?
The wind that consumes everything...
When you see beauty in anything,
Yet the beauty shan't stop killing.
It steals your breath and it holds you down,
It takes your life and gives a crown.

Nay not, say it again.
Nay not, say it again.
"We are trapped in the belly of this terrible machine, and the machine is bleeding to death."

This cocoon is only pretty from the outside.  Inside I can't breathe.  I don't breathe, and I see.

I explained further, "And we're on so many drugs with the radio on and the curtains drawn. And last night, for the briefest moment, I felt the world beyond these four fucked up walls, padding torn to shreds and stained with a thousand self-inflicted genocides. I felt it. These walls no longer contain me, they are but rust encrusted cellophane, and I have been beyond them." "They were right," he answered calmly, "you are insane." I smiled, content, reading the secret jealousy in his faux-concerned face.

"Is it me?" she cried frantically, "Is it me?" 
"It's all of us, baby, the whole damn world is spinning!"

"If you've got this far, you should've turned back" he told me.
"I know."
